commitResults.messageTitle: chore: Include assertions and checks for empty user inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently users are able to send an empty command and the bot will reply
that something has went wrong.

Users may be confused by the returned dialog despite not sending an
actual command.

Validating the user input before executing the command allows us to
prevent such empty commands.

Validating the input before executing the user command is a
straightforward solution that does not complicate the Parser class
logic.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: Sort tasks for easier viewing
chore: Refactor code to follow SLAP
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the parser class does not follow the SLAP principles due to
the validation logic.

This hurts the maintanability and readability of the Parser class as the
validation logic is occasionally abstracted while some are not. The
validation ocassionally comes in the middle of parsing which is not an
intuitive logic.

All validation logic are abstracted out and performed right at the start
when parsing the command. This gives a standardised order that is
easy to follow for readability.

Also, validation errors are now properly displayed to users due instead
of a generic message.
